text: Music Hall The Music Hall was a concert venue in Hanover, Germany. It was located in the "U-boat hall" on the former Hanomag complex. The structure was originally built in 1943 as a submarine production facility in the northern shipyard of Kriegsmarinewerft Wilhelmshaven. Notable performers included Rush, Sting, Roxette and David Bowie. The structure is now a furniture store. ==References== Category:Music venues in Germany Category:Former music venues in Germany Category:Buildings and structures in Hanover
title: Music Hall (Hanover)
